medical_history.chief_complaint: Ocular symptoms and motor neuron signs in a 63-year-old woman.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed parkinsonian gait disturbance at age 60, with progression to moderate parkinsonism and motor neuron signs, including rigidity in the upper extremities and muscle wasting by age 63. No factors for relief were mentioned.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a dense family history of ALS/PDC.
